trans-unit.source: Represents a variable-length stream of binary data to be stored in or retrieved from a database.
To obtain an <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary> object, call the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleDataReader.GetOracleBinary%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the `OracleBinary` structure, setting the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value"></xref> property to the contents of the supplied byte array.
The byte array to be stored in the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value"></xref> property.
Compares this <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> object to the supplied object and returns an indication of their relative values.
The object to be compared to this `OracleBinary` structure.
A signed number indicating the relative values of this `OracleBinary` structure and the object.
Return Value
Condition
Less than zero
The value of this `OracleBinary` object is less than the object.
Zero
This `OracleBinary` object is the same as the object.
Greater than zero
This `OracleBinary` object is greater than the object.
-or-
The object is a null reference.
Concatenates two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to create a new `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure with the concatenated values of the x and y parameters.
Compares the supplied object parameter to the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> object.
The object to be compared.
`true` if object is an instance of <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> and the two are equal; otherwise `false`.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if they are equal.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the two instances are equal or <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref> if the two instances are not equal.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Returns the hash code for this <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structure.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is greater than the second.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is greater than the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is greater than or equal to the second.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is greater than or equal to the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structure is null.
`true` if `Value` is null, otherwise `false`.
Gets the single byte from the `Value` property located at the position indicated by the integer parameter, index.
If index indicates a position beyond the end of the byte array, an exception is raised.
To avoid raising an `OracleNullValueException`, always check the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.IsNull%2A> property and the `Length` property before reading `this`.
The position of the byte to be retrieved.
The byte located at the position indicated by the integer parameter.
Gets the length in bytes of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value"></xref> property.
This property is read-only.
To avoid raising an `OracleNullValueException`, always check the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.IsNull%2A> property before reading the `Length` property.
The length of the binary data in the `Value` property.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is less than the second.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is less than the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is less than or equal to the second.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is less than or equal to the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if they are not equal.
An `OracleBinary` structure.
An `OracleBinary` structure.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the two instances are not equal or <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref> if the two instances are equal.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.

Represents a null value that can be assigned to the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Value"></xref> property of an <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structure.
`Null` functions as a constant for the `OracleBinary` structure.
Concatenates the two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> parameters to create a new `OracleBinary` structure.
`x` will appear first in the resulting `OracleBinary`, followed by `y`.
[Visual Basic]
In Visual Basic, you can use the operators defined by a class, but you cannot override them or create your own.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Concat%28System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%2CSystem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An `OracleBinary` object.
An `OracleBinary` object.
The concatenated values of the x and y parameters.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if they are equal.
The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.Equals%28System.Object%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An `OracleBinary` object.
An `OracleBinary` object.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the two instances are equal or <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref> if the two instances are not equal.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is greater than the second.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.GreaterThan%28System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%2CSystem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An `OracleBinary` object.
An `OracleBinary` object.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is greater than the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is greater than or equal to the second.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.GreaterThanOrEqual%28System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%2CSystem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An `OracleBinary` object.
An `OracleBinary` object.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is greater than or equal to the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if they are equal.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.NotEquals%28System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%2CSystem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An `OracleBinary` object.
An `OracleBinary` object.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the two instances are not equal or <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref> if the two instances are equal.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is less than the second.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.LessThan%28System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%2CSystem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An `OracleBinary` object.
An `OracleBinary` object.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is less than the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structures to determine if the first is less than or equal to the second.

The equivalent method for this operator is <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.LessThanOrEqual%28System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%2CSystem.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary%29?displayProperty=fullName>
An `OracleBinary` object.
An `OracleBinary` object.

An <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean"></xref> that is <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.True"></xref> if the first instance is less than or equal to the second instance, otherwise <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.False"></xref>.

If either instance of `OracleBinary` is null, the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Value"></xref> of the `OracleBoolean` will be <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBoolean.Null"></xref>.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary"></xref> structure.
This property is read-only.
To avoid raising an `OracleNullValueException`, always check the <xref:System.Data.OracleClient.OracleBinary.IsNull%2A> property before reading the `Value` property.
The value of the `OracleBinary` structure.
